head_text.subj: MANHATTAN, HORRIBLY POLLUTED AIR HALF-VEIL
THE STEEL AND CONCRETE TEETH OF THE ROCK ISLAND. A
HELICOPTER WHIZZES OVERHEAD.
RADIO VOICE

text: 96 degrees and climbing on the Central Park Parade Grounds -- the ol' Greenhouse Effect is humming today! Your Environmental Advisory Council sets the Discomfort Index at +9, the Risk Factor at 8.3, the highest it's been since August of 1978.

head_text.subj: SHOT OF BROOKLYN BRIDGE JAMMED WITH STALLED TRAFFIC SLOW
IN TO A STATION WAGON TOWING A LARGE CAMPER/TRAILER.
RADIO VOICE

text: The National Guard reports that skirmish in Brooklyn Heights has been pacified, and traffic on the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges is moving once again. If you are among those unlucky enough to be caught in that particular mess, please remain patient, and have your passes ready for inspection by the time you reach the gate. Now back to Ronny Lasar and more Golden Hits of the Seventies.

head_text.subj: SHOT OF THE CAR AND TRAILER DRIVING PAST A SIGN SAYING
"WELCOME TO NEW JERSEY" AFTER LEAVING A POLICE CHECK-POIN
THE GRATEFUL DEAD POUR FROM THE CAR'S RADIO, HOVERING ABO
IT AS IT TRACKS ALONG SMOKING SWAMPLAND AND INDUSTRIAL
SMOKESTACKS.
MUSIC

text: Sometimes a bright light's shining on me Other times I can barely see Lately it's occurred to me What a long strange trip it's been.

head_text.subj: A GIRL'S VOICE FROM INSIDE THE CAR PIPES UP IN IRRITATION
GIRL'S VOICE

text: God, will you please turn that cornball stuff off? I can't stand Seventies music END OF TITLES. FADE TO BLACK. SOUND OF INTERSPACIAL WIND. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CRAWL

text: In 1973, following the release of Last House on the Left, the writer/director of that film was committed for psychiatric observation. He was treated extensively with drugs group therapies, electroshock programs and a final lobotomy. Despite these efforts at reform, Craven killed his nurse, Maura Heaphy, and escaped to the Mohave Desert. At the end of 1000 days of meditation he was taken up by a jet- black saucer and trained in Secondary Media Infiltration and parametaphysical survival on the Planet Jupiter. Upon his graduation he was returned to the planet Earth at Exeter. This Film is his first since his return, and is respectfully dedicated to the memory of Maura Heaphy.

head_text.subj: AS THE CRAWL DEPARTS TOP SCREEN WE HEAR DISTANT THUNDER,
ARTILLERY.
THE SUN, A BLOOD-RE
HOLE IN THE FRYING ATMOSPHERE. A SUPERSONIC BOMBER BORES
ACROSS THE FACE OF THE FIERY STAR, PULLING A RUMBLING
CONTRAIL OF STEAM AFTER IT.
OPEN WITH A STARTLING RASP, AND A SOOTY TRAPDOOR SPIDER
CLATTERS OUT AND FREEZES, ALLOWING THE SPORES IN THE HOT
TO PENETRATE THE MOIST SENSORS BEHIND ITS UNBLINKING EYES
IT PLUMMETS ABRUPTLY BACK INTO ITS HOLE, SLAMMING THE HAT
A WEDGE OF SAND SIMMERS IN THE HEAT. A PACK RAT HURRIES F
A THICKET AND TUGS AT A GLEAMING OBJECT STUCK IN THE HARD
CLAY.
CUT TO A SHOT OF A SIDEWINDER COILING, LINING UP ITS FANG
WITH THE HEAT SENSORS IN ITS TONGUE FOR THE STRIKE.
THE PACK RAT JERKS ITS PRIZE FREE. WE CAN SEE IT'S A 50
CALIBER SHELL CASING. THE FANGS STRIKE THE RODENT SO HARD
FLIPS IN THE AIR, THEN CRASHES ONTO ITS BACK. INSTANTLY I
IS IN DEATH THROES. IT SHRIEKS WITH STARTLING LOUDNESS AN
PAIN.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: THE DESERT. NO SOUND
TERRAIN AT AN EXTREMELY FAST, AGILE PACE. IT VAULTS A
WASHOUT AND QUICKLY MOUNTS AN OUTCROPPING OF ROCK. THE VI
IS EVEN BETTER NOW, AND BELOW WE CAN SEE A LINE IN THE
DESERT. A ROAD.
LENS' POWER TO AN ANT-LIKE VEHICLE PULLING ITSELF OVER A
WAVERING LUMP IN THE GRAVEL LINE. IT'S LABORING TOWARDS U
SNUFFING THE AIR FOR A SCENT. OVER THE WEIRD SUBLIMINAL
ELECTRONIC MUSIC THAT HAS SLID BETWEEN THE RIBS OF THIS
MOMENT, WE HEAR THE SUDDEN CRACKLE OF A TWO-WAY RADIO.

text: (hoarse, feral) Pa pa? Pa pa?

head_text.subj: THE RADIO SNAPS AND A WOMAN'S VOICE REPLIES, ALSO COARSE,
HARD, VERY ALERT.
WOMAN'S VOICE

text: Pa pa huntin'. What you wan'?
Ma Ma, summin's cumin.

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: Army? P.O.V. No. Ain't cops, neither. It'sa car ana camper. I see it now.

head_text.subj: AS THE VOICE IDENTIFIES IT SO DO WE. THE MODERN SEDAN FRO
THE FIRST SCENES, BEAT UP AND RUSTED, LUGGING THE TRAILER
MA MA

text: Pluto. P.O.V. Yuh.

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: We're hungry.

head_text.subj: CUT TO INTERIOR OF CAR. THE SCALDING AIR ROARS IN THE OPE
WINDOWS, TEARING AT ANYTHING LOOSE. IN THE BACK AN INFANT
WAILS ON ITS MOTHER'S LAP, ITS FACE DARK. THE MOTHER, LYN
CARTER, A HANDSOME WOMAN OF 27, BRUSHES A MOIST STRAND OF
HAIR FROM HER EYES AND LOOKS HUMOROUSLY AT HER COMPANION
THE BACK SEAT
HER EYES IN DISGUST AT THEIR PARENTS, WHO SIT UP FRONT.
BRENDA

text: We're lost.

head_text.subj: THE GIRLS' MOTHER, ETHEL CARTER, FIGHTING TO KEEP THE MAP
HOLDS FROM FLYING OUT THE WINDOW, SHAKES HER HEAD VEHEMEN
ETHEL

text: Now we are not! We're right here, someplace, on this little blue road.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Ma, this road is definitely not a blue line. It's a dotted line if it's anything at all -- let me see that!

head_text.subj: BRENDA SNATCHES THE MAP FROM HER MOTHER AND GIVES IT TO H
SISTER, MUCH TO HER MOTHER'S PROTEST. LYNNE SCANS IT
QUICKLY.
BRENDA

text: (to her mother) What's the last town we passed? That one yesterday.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Um, well, I think it was Corn Creek. Or that's what we were supposed to --

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Oh, Jesus...

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: What...?

head_text.subj: SHOWS LYNNE'S FINGER IN C.U. POINTING TO WHERE THEY MIGHT
BRENDA

text: (horrified) "Nellis Air Force Range and Nuclear Testing Site. Closed to the Public." Good grief, Daddy! (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: BRENDA'S VOICE IS IMMEDIATELY HYSTERICAL, ACCUSATORY. AT
THIS POINT THE DRIVER OF THE CAR, FATHER OF THE GIRLS,
HUSBAND OF ETHEL
BOB

text: Alright, everybody settle down! THE CAR FALLS SILENT. EVEN THE BABY IS STARTLED.

head_text.subj: BOB

text: We are not on a bomb range, we are not goddamn lost, we are not --

head_text.subj: SOME TERRIBLE RUSHING NOISE THAT HAS BEEN BUILDING UNDER
LAST DOZEN WORDS TAKES OVER. A SUPERSONIC ONSLAUGHT OF JE
EXHAUST SHAKES THE CAR AND BLOTS OUT BOB'S WORDS. LOUDER,
LOUDER STILL, THEN SOMETHING HUGE FLASHES OVERHEAD. JUST
ABRUPTLY IT IS GONE.
BOB

text: Holy shit...

head_text.subj: BOB FLOORS THE ACCELERATOR. THE CAR LURCHES MADLY AHEAD,
WOMEN SCREAMING. LYNNE WHEELS ABOUT AND LOOKS FRANTICALLY
OUT THE BACK WINDOW AT THE TRAILER. A FRIGHTENED FACE
WOBBLES UP IN THE FRONT WINDOW OF THE TRAILER.
LYNNE

text: Daddy, for god's sakes slow down, you'll loose the trailer -- Doug and Bobby --

head_text.subj: BOB CARTER LOOKS INTO HIS REAR VIEW MIRROR, THEN TURNS AN
DESPITE THE TERRIFYING NATURE OF THIS, BOB'S ATTENTION IS
SNAPPED AWAY BY ANOTHER AIRCRAFT ROCKETING OVER HIS
AUTOMOBILE, ITS INCREDIBLE NOISE CRACKING THE WINDSHIELD.
ETHEL DIVES DOWN TOWARDS THE FLOOR, AND THE MAP SHE WAS J
REGAINING FLAPS AROUND THE INSIDE OF THE CAR LIKE A MADDE
BAT, THEN PLASTERS ITSELF ACROSS BOB'S FACE.
BOB TEARS THE MAP AWAY AND WRESTLES THE CAR AND TRAILER B
OFF THE SHOULDER, ROARING BACK ONTO THE HIGHWAY. DUST AND
ROCKS FLY UP ON ALL SIDES AND SMACK AGAINST THE UNDER-
CARRIAGE OF THE CAR
ETHEL THROWS HER HANDS UP.
ETHEL

text: Bob! Watch!

head_text.subj: THE BLUE OF THE ONCOMING ROAD. AN ANIMAL OF SOME SORT DAR
OUT IN FRONT OF THEM.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: BOB WRENCHES THE WHEEL AND THE CAR AND TRAILER SKID
SICKENINGLY TOWARD THE SHOULDER, STRAIGHTEN ONCE, THEN PL
DOWN A SLIGHT GRADE AND CLATTER TO A HALT AMONG ROCKS AND
CACTUS.
THERE IS A WHITEOUT OF DUST, AND IT IS ABSOLUTELY QUIET F
LONG MOMENT.
BRENDA

text: You and your stupid shortcuts, Daddy.

location: NEAR THE WRECKED CARS AND TRAILER

head_text.subj: BOB UNSCREWS THE CAP OF A THERMOS AND TAKES A LONG SWIG,
WIPES HIS MOUTH WITH THE BACK OF HIS HAND. HE LOOKS SHAKE
THOUGH HE WOULD NEVER ADMIT IT. LYNNE HANDS THE BABY TO
ETHEL AND RUNS AROUND TO THE DOOR OF THE TRAILER, FOLLOWE
BRENDA.
BOB

text: (to the desert) Twenty-five years I'm a cop in the worst goddamn precinct in New York City. The niggers shot arrows at me, the Puerto Ricans tried to kill me by throwing dogs at me from the fucking roofs! I was even shot at on three separate occasions by my own men by mistake, of course, but none of those bastards ever came as close to killing me as my own goddamn wife with her goddamn road maps and wrong turns and goddamn hysterical screaming and --

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: (reserved) You've soiled your pants.

head_text.subj: BOB

text: (arrested) I've what? (He stares at the stain on his trousers) That's coffee. I spilled my goddamn coffee -- Jesus, Ethel.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Watch your language.

head_text.subj: BOB

text: (straightening) I'm sorry. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: WE CUT TO THE BACK OF THE TRAILER. LYNNE AND BRENDA STRUG
WITH THE DOOR. SOMEONE'S POUNDING FROM WITHIN.
BRENDA

text: Unlock it, stupid!

head_text.subj: THERE'S A METALLIC CLICK, AND THE DOOR OPENS. BOBBY CARTE
BRENDA'S 20-YEAR-OLD BROTHER, STEPS OUT, SHAKILY, FOLLOWE
DOUG WOOD.
BOBBY CARTER IS A TALL, GOOD-LOOKING ALL-AMERICAN KID
BRIGHT, RUGGED, A LITTLE AWKWARD WITH HIS MANHOOD.
DOUG WOOD IS BRENDA'S SISTER, LYNNE'S "OLD MAN," 35, A
CASUALLY HANDSOME SCIENTIST. HE LIGHTS A CIGARETTE AND
SHAKES HIS HEAD.
DOUG

text: Now I know how Fearless Fosdick feels when he gets put in an ash can and kicked down the cellar stairs. What happened?

head_text.subj: HE JUMPS DOWN, FOLLOWED IMMEDIATELY BY TWO GERMAN SHEPHER
WHO ARE VERY EXCITED. THE FEMALE, "BEAUTY," RUSHES AROUND
WAGGING HER TAIL IN APOLOGY, SURE THE CRASH WAS SOMETHING
DID. THE MALE, A HUGE OLD SONUVABITCH CALLED "THE BEAST,"
STALKS OVER TO THE NEAREST CACTUS, RAISES A BACK LEG AND
STAKES HIS TERRITORY.
ALL OF THESE CHARACTERS FROM THE TRAILER SHOW THE SIGNS I
ONE WAY OR ANOTHER OF A VERY ROUGH LANDING.
LYNNE

text: (hugging Doug) I don't know. There was a couple of planes, and then some poor animal in the road -- You okay, boy?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Nothing broken. How 'bout you -- and Shanti?

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: We're both fine. She was crying before we went off the road, but now she seems quiet. BOBBY SLIDES UP TO BRENDA.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Brenda, aren't you going to ask if your darling brother is alright? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Na. Get out of here, Bobby.

head_text.subj: BOBBY PRESENTS HIS HAND, WHICH HE'S BEEN KEEPING BEHIND H
BACK. IT'S COVERED WITH RED GOO. BRENDA LETS OUT A
HORRIFIED SCREAM. BOBBY BEAMS.
BOBBY

text: You see? She does care.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (reassuringly) It's catsup, folks. Got it on me, too. The kitchen's all over the place in there.

head_text.subj: BOBBY SMEARS THE CATSUP ON BRENDA'S FACE. SHE LETS OUT AN
EVEN LOUDER SHRIEK AND CHASES BOBBY OFF AROUND THE TRAILE
BRENDA CHASES BOBBY UP THE INCLINE AND ONTO THE ROAD, WHE
HE EASILY OUTDISTANCES HER. AFTER CHASING HIM SOME WAYS S
THE FIRST TIME JUST WHERE THEY ARE. SHE SEES THE ROAD
SPINNING OFF LIKE A RIBBON OF GRAVEL AND DUST INTO THE
WAVERING INFINITY OF HEAT. NOTHING AROUND HER LOOKS AT AL
LIKE ANYTHING HE'S EVER KNOWN IN HER LIFE. IT IS DEATHLY
STILL. AND NOWHERE SAVE FOR THE ROAD AND THEIR VEHICLES I
THERE SIGN OF MAN'S HAND.
THE CAR AND TRAILER SEEM VERY VERY SMALL.
THE BADLANDS OF THE DESERT ARE IMMENSE. WEIRD STONE
FORMATIONS. STRANGE CACTUSES, AND A STILL, ENDLESS VACUUM
SOMETHING CROSSES SILENTLY ACROSS THE GROUND BEFORE HER.
SHADOW. BRENDA LOOKS UP. A SINGLE DARK BIRD, LARGE, VERY
FAR UP, WHEELS SLOWLY ABOVE HER. IT MAKES NO SOUND, BUT
SIMPLY KEEPS HER AT THE CENTER OF ITS CIRCLE.
BRENDA SHADES HER EYES AND WATCHES FOR A LONG MOMENT.
BOBBY COMES BACK, IN A SOMBER MOOD NOW.
BOBBY

text: Turkey buzzard. Janitor of the desert

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Does that mean there's a town nearby? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: (smiling) You mean like when stranded sailors see sea birds and know they're nearing land?

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Yeah.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: No.

head_text.subj: BRENDA AND BOBBY WALKING BACK TOWARD
CAR AND TRAILER. BOBBY PUTS HIS ARM AROUND HIS SISTER'S
SHOULDER AS THEY WALK. ESPECIALLY AT THIS DISTANCE AND
HEIGHT, INFINITE BADLANDS AROUND THEM, THEY ARE REVEALED
ONCE AS VULNERABLE AND CARING. HUMAN PREY.
A RADIO CRACKLES.
MA MA

text: (radio) Pluto?

head_text.subj: PLUTO

text: (P.0.V. Voice) They off t'road. Stuck.

head_text.subj: FILTHY YOUNG MASCULINE HAND BRINGS THEM INTO FRAME AND PL
THEM NEXT TO THE WALKIE-TALKIE. THE RADIO WE SEE IS OLIVE
DRAB, "U.S. ARMY" STENCILED ON ITS SIDE. THE HAND AND ARM
HOWEVER, ARE NOT ARMY. STRANGE RINGS, BRACELETS OF PLAITE
BONE AND HAIR, TORN AND DIRTY NAILS.
THE HAND BEGINS TRACING SOMETHING IN THE RED DIRT. A CRUD
CIRCLE. ANOTHER. SOME MORE LINES, FASTER NOW. THE HAND
DRAWS THE OUTLINE AND WE SEE THE FIGURE IS OF A GIRL
THE HAND WITHDRAWS TREMBLING, THEN MOVES BACK, CARESSING.
PERHAPS ERASING, FOR THE DRAWING IS DESTROYED.
C.U. OF BRENDA, LEFT ALONE BY BOBBY, WHO JUMPS DOWN TO JO
THE REST OF HIS FAMILY. BRENDA STANDS WATCHING. SHE LOOKS
ABOUT HER, UNEASILY, NOT SURE WHAT SHE'S FEELING. SHE LOO
UP TOWARD THE OUTCROPPING, THEN AWAY.
THE TWO GERMAN SHEPHERDS LIE IN THE SHADE OF THE CAMPER.
BEAUTY, THE FEMALE, IS FREE
BEAUTY STIRS, GETS UP, HER NOSE IN THE AIR. SHE LETS OUT
"WHUFF" AND GOES ROUND THE TRAILER. THE BEAST TRIES TO
FOLLOW BUT IS PREVENTED BY HIS LEASH.
BEAUTY JOINS BRENDA AND AGAIN SORTS THROUGH THE AIR, A
GROWLING BARK BEING THE RESULT. THEN SHE BEGINS BARKING I
MORE CERTAINTY, SPACING THEM LIKE SONAR.
BRENDA WATCHES, AMBIVALENT.
THE WIND IS DYING. THE DOG'S BARKING IS SWALLOWED WITHOUT
ECHO IN THE VAST SILENCE.
BOBBY

text: (calling 0.S.) Beauty! C'mere, girl! BEAUTY LEAVES FOR THE FAMILY.

head_text.subj: BEAUTY COMES WAG-TAILING DOWN TO BOBBY, HEAD LOW, TONGUE
LYNNE AND DOUG ARE WATCHING BOB SENIOR CRAWL AROUND UNDER
CAR. ETHEL, NOTHING BETTER TO DO, WORRIES ABOUT THE DOG.
ETHEL

text: Maybe you should tie Beauty up, Bobby. We don't want her running off after a rabbit and disappearing, like she did in Montana.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: That was the Beast that did that, not Beauty, and it was a bitch in South Dakota, not a rabbit in Montana. Beauty always comes when I call her.

head_text.subj: CUT TO BRENDA MATTER-OF-FACTLY CRAWLING UNDER THE CAR TO
WHAT HER FATHER'S UP TO.
BRENDA

text: What's the verdict? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOB

text: I don't wanna say it, but I think the axle's snapped.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Can't you fix it?

head_text.subj: BOB

text: No.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: What'1ll we do?

head_text.subj: BOB

text: Punt.

head_text.subj: C.U. OF A .38 POLICE SPECIAL. A MAN'S HAND REVOLVES THE
CYLINDER TO VERIFY IT'S FULLY LOADED, THEN SNAPS IT SHUT.
M.S. BOB HANDS THE GUN TO HIS SON, BOBBY.
BOB

text: Don't shoot 'till you see the whites of their eyes.

head_text.subj: SMOKING. BRENDA AND LYNNE AREN'T IN SIGHT. BIG BOB HAS A
GUN, ALSO.
ETHEL

text: Don't try to make me feel silly. Who knows what kind of animals live out here?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: I do. I did a paper on desert ecology. Biggest thing out here is the coyote. He's too smart to bother with us.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: What about snakes and bugs.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: (granting her a point) They won't bother us if we don't bother them. ETHEL NODS, FEELING JUSTIFIED IN HER WORRIES, NOW. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
ETHEL

text: If it's all the same to you, I'll put my faith in the Lord and that gun, rather than coyotes and rattlesnakes.

head_text.subj: CUT TO REAR OF TRAILER. BRENDA IS OUTSIDE THE REAR DOOR,
HIDDEN FROM VIEW, TAKING A FURTIVE DRAG ON A JOINT. LYNNE
COMES OUT FROM THE DOOR UNEXPECTEDLY. BRENDA HIDES THE JO
BEHIND HER BACK, CAUGHT ON THE INHALE.
LYNNE

text: Well, at least Shanti's taking all this calmly. They decide to go for help? (she nods toward the family.)

head_text.subj: BRENDA NODS "OH, SURE." LYNNE LIGHTS UP AND WATCHES HER
LITTLE SISTER.
LYNNE

text: You'll blow up if you don't breathe, you know.

head_text.subj: BRENDA EXPELS THE SMOKE WITH A GASP. LYNNE SMILES WRYLY A
NODS. DOUG CALLS FROM OFFSCREEN.
DOUG, (0.S.)

text: Lynne?!

head_text.subj: LYNNE EXITS WITHOUT A WORD TO BRENDA. BRENDA IS LEFT GASP
AND COUGHING.
BRENDA

text: Oh, man...

head_text.subj: DOUG, BOB AND ETHEL CONFER ON THE ROAD JUST ABOVE THE CAR
TRAILER. LYNNE COMES UP TO DOUG, TAKING HIS HAND.
DOUG

text: (a bit too casually) Your Dad and I are going to take a walk see if we can find some help.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: (to Doug) Aren't you taking a gun, Doug? Bob'1ll give you one. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
DOUG

text: Thanks, Mom, but I've got my five fingers of death, here. (he mimes a comic strike)

head_text.subj: BOB

text: (shrugging, adjusting his own shoulder holster) Doug'll go that way, me back the way we came.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (checking his watch) It's 3:30. We've five hours of daylight left.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Well, how far can you go in two hours?

head_text.subj: BOB

text: Seven miles, maybe; it'll give us a chance to find something.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: What do you expect to find out here? We're in the middle of nowhere.

head_text.subj: BOB

text: Well, for one thing, we passed some sort of station about five miles back...

head_text.subj: NO ONE REMEMBERS. BOBBY COMES UP FROM THE TRAILER WITH A
CANTEEN OF WATER AND A THERMOS. BOB TAKES THE THERMOS, DO
THE CANTEEN. BRENDA COMES UP, TOO.
BOB

text: (to Bobby) You're in charge here, now.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: That's sexism. He's not in charge of me.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: I'm in charge. Alright, get going, then! THE MEN LAUGH AT THE WOMAN'S MIME OF MILITARY AUTHORITY.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Synchronize watches! It's 3:38. If you're not back by 8:30 we'll send the dogs out after you! Good hunting, men! (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
THE THREE MEN THROW EACH OTHER COMIC SALUTES.
ETHEL

text: Can we just have a word of prayer? EVERYONE FALLS SERIOUS.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Oh, Mother, for crying out loud...

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Just to ask the Lord to watch over us all. Is that too much to ask? Bob? BOB NODS. EVERYONE STEPS A LITTLE CLOSER TOGETHER.

head_text.subj: THEM FROM ABOVE, WI
HUGS BETWEEN THE COUPLES, SOME WAVES, AND THE MEN STARTS
IN OPPOSITE DIRECTIONS. AT FULL PULL BACK, THE LITTLE GRO
LOOKS VERY SMALL, VERY VULNERABLE. BEAUTY BARKS UP IN OUR
DIRECTION UNTIL SHE'S CALLED BACK TO THE TRAILER WITH BOB
DISSOLVE TO SEVERAL HOURS LATER. BOBBY IS LEVELING THE
TRAILER AS BEST HE CAN WITH THE TRAILER'S JACKS AND ROCKS
PROPPED UNDER.
LYNNE AND BRENDA ARE SPREADING A CLOTH OVER AN ALUMINUM
PICNIC TABLE.
BEAUTY CONTINUES TO BARK UP AT THE OUTCROPPING.
BRENDA

text: Beauty, shut up, already!

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Beauty!

head_text.subj: THE DOG DROPS HER HEAD AND SKULKS OVER TO BOBBY. HE PUTS
INTO THE BACK OF THE CAMPER AS ETHEL EMERGES WITH FOOD,
HEADING FOR THE TABLE.
ETHEL

text: Bring some plates, would you?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Sure.

head_text.subj: ETHEL BRINGS THE FOOD ROUND TO THE TABLE AND THE THREE WO
ARE TOGETHER FOR THE FIRST TIME BY THEMSELVES.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
LYNNE

text: This is a fine way to spend the eve of your twenty-fifth wedding anniversary.

head_text.subj: ETHEL WIPES HER HANDS ON HER JEANS AND PUTS ON A LIGHT
JACKET.
ETHEL

text: Well, it's kind of a pretty place. And there's certainly a lot of sunshine. I don't think I've seen so much sunshine since I was a girl.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Gives me the creeps.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Your system just doesn't know what to do with clean air and room to stretch.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: (off on her own thoughts) I suppose it's my fault we got lost...

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Don't be ridiculous, Ma -- it was Daddy's stupid idea to try sneaking in the back way. We had enough to bribe the border guards.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: We could've been in California by now if we'd staying on route 93. Showers... Fresh fruit... BEAUTY CONTINUES TO BARK FROM INSIDE THE TRAILER.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: What do you suppose is bugging her?

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Rattlesnakes, I'll bet. BOBBY RETURNS WITH PAPER PLATES AND PLASTIC SILVERWARE.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: You guys kill me.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: I wonder why the Beast isn't chiming in? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY

text: (helping self to food) He knows better. He never barks, anyway, he just goes for the kill whenever he gets the chance.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: He sure does!

head_text.subj: BEAST." HE IS GETTING UP, SNIFFING THE AIR, LEANING AGAIN
THE LENGTH OF HIS CHAIN, STRAINING SILENTLY OFF TOWARD TH
STONE BLUFF ACROSS THE ROAD. WE CAN HEAR ETHEL COMPLETE H
LINES 0.S.
ETHEL

text: (continuing) Remember that poodle he almost killed in Miami. Oh, boy, was that lady fit to be tied!

head_text.subj: "BEAUTY" IS BARKING FRANTICALLY INSIDE THE TRAILER, HER N
SCRATCHING AGAINST THE ALUMINUM DOOR.
CUT BACK TO THE FAMILY AT THE TABLE.
BRENDA

text: Was Daddy ever mad! He had to pay the vet bills! THEY ALL LAUGH AT THE REMEMBRANCE. THERE'S A SHIFT.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: So, Lynne, when are you and Doug going to make it official? THERE'S AN AWKWARD SILENCE. LYNNE LIGHTS A CIGARETTE.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Maybe when we reach our twenty-fifth anniversary, like Mama and Daddy.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: I won't comment...

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: (anticipating) "But..." (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
ETHEL

text: But it seems to me awfully backward the way you two are doing things. I mean that sweet little baby of yours...

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: A bastard?

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: That's not what I was going to say. My granddaughter is... no bastard.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Can a girl be a bastard, anyway? (to Bobby) What's the female of Bastard?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Bassinet.

head_text.subj: BRENDA BEANS BOBBY WITH AN APPLE FOR THAT ONE. BOBBY CHAS
HER AROUND THE TABLE, BOTH KNOCKING THINGS OVER, THEN BRE
RUNS FOR THE TRAILER. BEFORE BOBBY CAN STOP HER SHE'S OPE
THE DOOR. "BEAUTY" BOLTS OUT AND IS GONE LIKE A SHOT.
BOBBY

text: Beauty! Get back here!

head_text.subj: BEAUTY SHOOTS ACROSS THE ROAD, THROUGH THE BRUSH AND UP I
THE ROCKS. SHE'S ALREADY OUT OF SIGHT WHEN BOBBY GAINS TH
ROAD, BUT NOT OUT OF HEARING. HER HYSTERICAL, ANGRY BARKI
AND THE SOUNDS OF HER CRASHING THROUGH BRUSH, KICKING LOO
STONES ON HER WAY UP
AND NOW "THE BEAST" IS BARKING TOO, LEAPING AGAINST THE
RESTRICTION OF HIS CHAIN. BOBBY HESITATES A MOMENT, NOT
KNOWING WHAT TO MAKE OF IT. BRENDA RUNS UP AND JOINS HIM.
HE STARTS OFF AFTER "BEAUTY."
BRENDA

text: Bobby !? SHE CATCHES UP WITH HIM AND TRIES TO HAND HIM THE GUN.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Humor me. THE TWO EXCHANGE GLANCES. BOBBY SHAKES HIS HEAD.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: You're the one that's so scared. You keep it. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
HE RUNS UP THE STEEP INCLINE AND INTO THE ROCKS.
"BEAUTY" DIGS HER WAY UP, REALLY AFTER SOMETHING, PASSING
OUR CAMERA POSITION THAT WE CAN HEAR THE AIR
WHISTLING IN HER THROAT AND OVER HER TEETH. FAR BELOW WE
HEAR BOBBY CALLING.
BOBBY, (0.S.)

text: Beauty! C'mon back, girl!

head_text.subj: BOBBY STRUGGLES FROM ROCK TO ROCK, GASPING FOR AIR AS HE
CLIMBS. HE STOPS TO CALL, HIS VOICE CRACKING WITH STRAIN
AN UNNAMEABLE FEAR.
BOBBY

text: Beauty! Beauty! HE STRUGGLES UPWARD AGAIN, TRYING TO GO FASTER.

head_text.subj: "BEAUTY" BREAKS OVER THE UPPER REACHES AND ONTO FIRST LEV
GROUND OF THE TOP. SHE CASTS ABOUT ANGRILY FOR THE SCENT,
THEN STARTS TO GO OFF IN ONE DIRECTION, STILL NOT SURE.
. VOICE

text: Hey, pig.

head_text.subj: "BEAUTY" WHIRLS AROUND SO FAST SHE ALMOST FALLS, HER HACK
UP, HER LIPS PULLED BACK OVER LETHAL TEETH, HER EYES FLAS
WITH THE LOW RED SUN THAT'S DIRECTLY IN THEM. SHE LAYS BA
HER EARS AND GATHERS HERSELF.
CUT TO A SHOT FROM THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION, GROUND LEVEL.
LEG STEPS INTO VIEW, FRAMING "BEAUTY" AS SHE SPRINGS INTO
CHARGE, SOME TWENTY YARDS AWAY. WE MIGHT NOTICE THE FOOT
SHOD IN A RATTY "P F FLYER," RUDE BRACELETS OF WIRE AT TH
ANKLE, THE HAIRY BARE LEG STEPPING INTO A CROUCH AS THE B
DOG LUNGES.
BOBBY STOPS IN HIS CLIMB AT THE SOUND OF THE SCREAM. IT'S
LONG, TERRIFYING CRY, HALF-ANIMAL, HALF-HUMAN, PARALYZING
ITS FEROCITY. IT'S FOLLOWED IMMEDIATELY BY THE AWFUL OUTC
OF A DOG IN RAGING PAIN. THEN SNARLS AND WHOOPS, CRASHING
BRUSH. ROCKS RAIN BY AND BOBBY DIVES FOR COVER. AN AWFUL
HOWL, A SOUND OF AN ANIMAL SHAKING SOMETHING MERCILESSLY
ITS TEETH, THEN ITS OVER.
BOBBY'S FACE. THE YOUNGSTER IS FROZEN WITH FEAR.
SCRUB JAYS FLASH BY OVERHEAD, SCREECHING THEIR WARNINGS.
THEN THERE'S AN OPPRESSIVE SILENCE. IT'S SO QUIET WE CAN
HEAR BOBBY'S TEETH CHATTERING.
THE WOMEN GATHER IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROUGH ROAD, HUDDLED
SOMETHING OUT IN THE DEEPENING SHADOWS HIGH ABOVE THEM. T
LOW SUN IS TURNING THE ENTIRE PEAK OF THE STONE PINNACLE
SCARLET.
ETHEL LOOKS UP THE HILL AND CALLS TO HER SON.
ETHEL

text: Bobby! Come down, now!

head_text.subj: BOBBY LOOKS BACK DOWN THE HILL AT THE DISTANT CALL OF HIS
MOTHER. HE SHAKES HIMSELF AND LOOKS BACK UP.
BOBBY

text: Beauty? THERE'S NO SIGN FROM UP THERE. BOBBY STARTS CLIMBING UP, HIS FACE SET.

head_text.subj: DISSOLVE TO
BOBBY CLIMBS OVER THE LAST ROCK CAUTIOUSLY AND STANDS SHA
AMONG THE LONG SHADOWS AND RED-RIMMED ROCKS. HE LOOKS ARO
HIMSELF. EVERYWHERE THE GROUND IS TORN, THE BRUSH TRAMPLE
AND THERE IS HAIR, IN BLOODY CLOTS, STICKING TO BROKEN
BRANCHES.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY

text: (quietly) Beauty?

head_text.subj: HE WAITS IN VAIN FOR SOME SORT OF ANSWER. A SULLEN WIND
PRESSES AGAINST HIS BACK. HE SHIVERS, NERVES ON EDGE.
HE TAKES A STEP AND SLIPS ON BLOOD.
HE FOLLOWS A BLOOD TRAIL, THE HAIRS ON THE BACK OF HIS NE
PRICKLING AS THEY RISE.
BOBBY FINDS "BEAUTY" ON HER BACK ATOP A YELLOW PLATE OF R
HER LEGS FROZEN AND SPLAYED AGAINST THE RED SKY, HER PURP
TONGUE SWOLLEN OVER HER TEETH.
SHE HAS BEEN DISEMBOWELED, HER INTESTINES TORN OUT AND LY
ABOUT HER.
BOBBY'S FACE, HIS EYES GLAZED AND UNBELIEVING.
SOMETHING MOVES IN THE BRUSH BEHIND HIM.
WILDLY, BLINDLY, HE PITCHES HIMSELF INTO A HEADLONG RUN D
THE DARKENING WALL OF ROCK, FALLING, ROLLING, LURCHING UP
RUNNING EVEN HARDER.
SUDDEN SILENCE TO THIS CUT. THE SKY RUNS RED AS THE PLANE
ROTATES THE DESERT TOWARDS DARKNESS. THE ARTERIAL LIGHT O
THE SUN WRITHES ON THE HORIZON, AND THE MOLTEN BALL BEGIN
DISINTEGRATE INTO DUSK.
NEARER THE TRAILER LYNNE HEAPS DRY BRANCHES ON A BONFIRE.
FLAMES SPIN UP LIKE DERVISHES, SHAPING AND HISSING TENDRI
OF SPARKS SCREW EVEN HIGHER. THE HEAT AND LIGHT PRESS LYN
BACK.
BRENDA, HERSELF WEARING A GREEN DOWN JACKET, ARRIVES WITH
JACKET FOR LYNNE, WHO QUICKLY PUTS IT ON.
LYNNE

text: Jesus, it must have dropped twenty degrees in the last hour.

head_text.subj: SHE FINDS A PACK OF CIGARETTES IN THE JACKET POCKET AND
LIGHTS UP. THE SISTERS AVOID EACH OTHER'S EYES. OFF SCREE
WE HEAR THE MOTHER SPEAKING SOME SORT OF GIBBERISH.
INSIDE THE TRAILER THINGS ARE HALF TOPSY-TURVY, HALF
STRAIGHTENED UP. SINCE THERE'S NO CAMPGROUND ELECTRICAL
OUTLET TO PLUG INTO, THE ONLY LIGHT SOURCE IS A CANDLE.
ETHEL IS STRUGGLING WITH THE FAMILY'S C/B UNIT, TRYING TO
CALL FOR HELP. SHE HAS THE OWNER'S MANUAL SPREAD BEFORE H
AND IS DOING HER BEST TO FEEL SHE KNOWS WHAT SHE'S DOING.
ETHEL

text: Calling Smokey the Bear, calling Smokey the Bear, this is Moby Grape... hello?

head_text.subj: THE RADIO HISSES EMPTILY. ETHEL POKES A FEW BUTTONS
EXPERIMENTALLY AND TRIES AGAIN.
ETHEL

text: (improvising) Maypole, maypole, this is Moby Grape calling. Hello there, um...

head_text.subj: LYNNE ENTERS AND SITS BESIDE HER MOTHER, SMOOTHING THE OL
WOMAN'S HAIR.
LYNNE

text: It's "Mayday," Mom, not "Maypole."

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Oh. ETHEL SHRUGS IN EXASPERATION.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Darn thing won't ever work for me. Guess I don't have the touch.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Let me have a try. THE MOTHER SCOOTS OVER AND LYNNE TAKES THE MICROPHONE.

head_text.subj: EXT. A HIGH PLACE
C.U. OF THE ARMY RADIO FOREGROUND. JUST B/G WE CAN SEE PA
OF A HUNKERED-DOWN BODY, AND THE ARMS OF THE YOUNG SAVAGE
HE TIES A DIRTY BANDAGE AROUND A BLOODY FOREARM. LYNNE'S
VOICE CRACKLES FROM THE RADIO.
LYNNE

text: Mayday, Mayday, this is Mobile Unit 2345CB. We are stranded and in need of assistance. Does anybody read us? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
THE BANDAGE IS TIED. THERE'S A PAUSE, THEN THE ARMY RADIO
PICKED UP.
LYNNE IS JUST ABOUT TO SPEAK AGAIN WHEN A SHORT BURST OF
HEAVY, RASPINGLY OBSCENE BREATHING COMES FROM HER RECEIVE
IT'S FOLLOWED IMMEDIATELY BY THE STATIC SNAP OF SOMEONE
RELEASING THE TALK BUTTON. THE RADIO IS ONCE AGAIN SILENT
THE TWO WOMEN STARE AT THE SET AS IF IT WERE ALIVE.
LYNNE

text: (quietly) What the hell was that? ETHEL SITS BACK, STILL STARING AT THE RADIO.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: It sounded like some sort of animal...

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: If the animals out here are smart enough to run a goddamn radio, we're in serious trouble.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Watch your language.

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Where's Bobby and the men, anyway.

head_text.subj: LYNNE TURNS AND LOOKS TOWARD THE DARK WINDOWS, THE ORANGE
LIGHT OF THE BONFIRE LICKING HER FEATURES.
THE LIGHT AT THE HORIZON HAS GONE FROM SCARLET TO DEEP PU
THAT TATTERS OFF TO GRAY. THE REST OF THE SKY PRESSES DOW
BLACK AND COLD.
THE BONFIRE IS SMALLER NOW, UNABLE TO LIVE FOR LONG WITHO
FRESH FUEL.
LYNNE STEPS FROM THE TRAILER AND LOOKS TOWARD THE FIRE.
BRENDA IS GONE.
LYNNE

text: Brenda?  26 23.

head_text.subj: BRENDA STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE GRAVEL ROAD, THE BIG M
GERMAN SHEPHERD "THE BEAST" WITH HER ON A CHAIN LEASH. IT
DARK, AND TO BRENDA, VERY MUCH A CITY GIRL, EVERY SHADOW
ALIVE. SHE STARES EACH WAY DOWN THE MURKY ROAD. IT'S
IMPOSSIBLE TO SEE MORE THAN FIFTY YARDS.
BRENDA

text: (calling) Bobbeeee!

head_text.subj: HER VOICE RETURNS AT INTERVALS FROM THE HIGH STONE
BUTTRESSES. BUT THERE'S NO ANSWER FROM HER BROTHER. THE
GIRL STARES AT THE DARK TREES AND THE SLOPE THAT RUNS UP
BEHIND, AND TAKES A TENTATIVE STEP IN THEIR DIRECTION. TH
STOPS.
SHE THINKS SHE MIGHT HAVE HEARD SOMETHING.
"THE BEAST" LETS OUT A "WHUFF" AND POINTS HIS EARS. A MOM
LATER HE CHARGES WITHOUT WARNING INTO THE DARK TREES, YAN
BRENDA OFF BALANCE.
BRENDA

text: Beast! Get back here! THE DOG IS GONE.

head_text.subj: BRENDA GETS UP AND BRUSHES HERSELF OFF. THE WOODS ARE
SILENT.
LYNNE

text: (calling from back by the trailer) Brenda? You there? BRENDA LOOKS BACK TOWARDS THE TRAILER FOR A MOMENT.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: (calling) In a minute, Lynne.

head_text.subj: THE GIRL TURNS BACK TOWARD THE HILLSIDE AND STARTS TOWARD
IT...
SHE MAKES HERSELF WALK INTO THE TREES UNTIL THE ROAD IS L
BEHIND HER AND SHE IS IN DEEP SHADOW.
BRENDA

text: Bobby? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
NO ANSWER. SHE MOVES DEEPER INTO THE DARK, PAUSES AGAIN.
NOT FAR OFF SOMETHING MOVES IN THE TREES.
BRENDA

text: (hushed) Bobby?

head_text.subj: HER FACE, HER EYES LARGE AND LIQUID. HER SKIN
PALLID IN THE STARLIGHT. SHE DOESN'T BREATHE. THERE'S
RUN, BUT HOLDS HER GROUND AND FACES THE SOUND.
BOBBY EMERGES FROM THE TREES, FOLLOWING "THE BEAST"
BRENDA

text: Oh, thank God.

head_text.subj: CUT TO THE ROAD. BOBBY, BRENDA AND "THE BEAST" CLIMB ONTO
THE GRAVEL. BRENDA MUSES TO LISTEN.
BOBBY

text: (very quietly) Dad and Doug back?

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: (still looking down the road) Not yet. (she turns to her brother) You didn't find Beauty? BOBBY TURNS AND WALKS OFF.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: She must have run off.

head_text.subj: HE TUGS "THE BEAST" AFTER HIM. THE BIG DOG SEEMS TO WANT
HEAD BACK INTO THE WOODS.
CUT TO A SHOT THROUGH SOME BRUSH TO THE DISTANT TRAILER A
BONFIRE, WHERE LYNNE AND ETHEL HEAP MORE FUEL ONTO THE
FLAMES. A SLIGHT MOVEMENT OF THE CAMERA PUTS MORE BRANCHE
POINT OF VIEW OF SOMEONE IN HIDING.
BRENDA, BOBBY AND "THE BEAST" ENTER THE CIRCLE OF FIRELIG
THEY ARE GREETED BY THE TWO OLDER WOMEN, BOBBY WITH SPECI
WARMTH. ALL ARE TOO FAR AWAY TO BE HEARD. THEIR GESTURES
INDICATE THAT THEY ARE RELIEVED, PUZZLED ABOUT THE ABSENC
THE MEN, BOBBY IS GIVEN A COAT.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
AS THE GROUP MOVES TOWARDS THE TRAILER A DARK HAND RELEAS
BRANCH, AND OUR VIEW IS CUT OFF.
ETHEL COOKS AT THE BUTANE BURNER. LYNNE FEEDS THE BABY,
SHANTI, WHO FUSSES A LOT. BRENDA IS SLUMPED IN A CORNER
DRINKING A COKE AND WATCHING BOBBY.
BOBBY SITS FOREGROUND, FACING AWAY FROM THE GROUP, PALE,
IN THOUGHT. ETHEL LOOKS AT HIM.
ETHEL

text: You want cheese on your hamburger?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: I don't want anything. ETHEL STUDIES HER SON.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: You sick or something.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Yeah, a little. Nothing serious. Did anyone try the C/B?

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: We tried. Nothing.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Once it sounded like the thing was an obscene phone caller.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: What do you mean?

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Well, it sort of huffed and puffed, like, wouldn't you say so, Lynne?

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: It was static. BOBBY LOOKS AT THE TWO WOMEN.

head_text.subj: ETHEL

text: Wasn't.

head_text.subj: THERE IS A SHARP THUMP AND A RASP FROM OUTSIDE THE TRAILE
BOBBY JUMPS DESPITE HIMSELF, THEN ENFORCES HIS AIR OF CAL
HE PICKS UP THE PISTOL AND OPENS THE DOOR.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BRENDA MAKES TO FOLLOW, BUT BOBBY MOTIONS FOR HER TO STAY
AND HE SHUTS THE DOOR BEHIND HIM.
BRENDA

text: He's such a Macho.

head_text.subj: SHE PULLS BACK A CURTAIN AND STRAINS TO SEE SOMETHING IN
DARK OUTSIDE.
THE FIRE IS DOWN TO EMBERS THAT OFFER SCANT LIGHT. BUT A
GREENISH EMBOLUS OF A MOON HOVERS IN THE SKY NOW, RISING
SLOWLY AS A GAS BUBBLE IN THICK ACID. THIS IS LIGHT ENOUG
FOR BOBBY TO SEE THAT "THE BEAST" HAS BROKEN HIS CHAIN AN
GONE.
BOBBY LOOKS OFF INTO THE DARK, SHIVERING SUDDENLY. HE
SWALLOWS AND LOOKS UP AT THE SKY.
BOBBY

text: Oh, Jesus, what's going on?

head_text.subj: CUT TO BOBBY THROWING MORE AND MORE DRY WOOD ON THE FIRE
UNTIL IT'S ROARING UP TO FULL HEIGHT AGAIN. IT'S BECOMING
DIFFICULT TO FIND MORE WOOD. BOBBY FINDS ONE LAST BRANCH,
THROWS IT ON, THEN STEPS BACK.
THE FIRE SEEMS TO ASSURE HIM. A LITTLE.
CUT TO THE MOON, NOW AT ITS APOGEE. A COYOTE CALLS DOWN A
CANYON.
BOBBY TURNS. SOMEONE IS CLAMBERING DOWN THE ROCKS BETWEEN
THE ROAD AND THE TRAILER. BOBBY COCKS THE PISTOL AND AIMS
DOUGLAS WALKS FROM THE SHADOWS, A BIG GRIN ON HIS FACE.
DOUG

text: Hey, don't shoot. I surrender

head_text.subj: BOBBY TURNS TO THE FIRE
CUT TO DOUG WARMING HIS BODY AT THE FIRE, ROTATING TO THA
AT HIM.
DOUG

text: Did I miss dinner?

head_text.subj: NO ANSWER FROM BOBBY, WHO IS PITCHING STONES INTO THE FIR
DOUG

text: You and Brenda have another fight? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY TURNS TO DOUG, STUFFING HIS HANDS IN HIS BACK POCKE
BOBBY

text: Dad's not back yet... and where were you?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: It's a lot slower going out there than we thought. Big Bob's surely on his way back. And he'll see the fire... If nothing else, we'll just send the Beast out after him. The Beast always gets his man.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: The Beast broke free and took off half an hour ago. Beauty's dead.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Beauty's what?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: She chased off right after you and Dad left. She was after something. She caught up with whatever it was on top of that bluff. By the time I got up there she was dead.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (sobered) Must've been a cougar, something big like that.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: She was gutted. DOUG STUFFS TOBACCO INTO THE BOWL OF HIS PIPE.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: A cougar might do that. Nothing else around capable of taking on a German Shepherd, anyway. Beauty was no pussycat.

head_text.subj: BOBBY DOESN'T ANSWER, BUT HE'S STUDYING DOUG'S FACE FOR S
OF FEAR.
DOUG

text: You tell the others?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: No. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
DOUG

text: Just as well.

head_text.subj: DOUG LOOKS AROUND. THE BRIGHT CIRCLE OF THE FIRE PITCHES
EVERYTHING ELSE INTO DARK TWISTING SHADOW. THE DOOR OF TH
TRAILER IS THROWN OPEN, DOUG IS VISIBLY STARTLED, AND BOB
NOTICES.
BRENDA COMES RUNNING OUT WITH A SHOUT, THROWING HER ARMS
AROUND DOUG. LYNNE COMES RIGHT AFTER, FOLLOWED BY ETHEL
HOLDING THE BABY. THERE IS GREAT RELIEF IN THE AIR, THE
WOMEN CROWDING AROUND DOUG.
ETHEL

text: I knew when you smelled food you'd show up!

head_text.subj: LYNNE

text: Find anything? SHE KISSES HIM, GIVING BRENDA A PLAYFUL SHOVE AWAY.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: There's a sort of blockhouse, abandoned, about five miles out. Nothing in it. Looks like it used to be used by the Military.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: You go any further?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: There isn't any further. The road ends there. (avoiding further discussion) I'm starving.

head_text.subj: THEY ALL GO INTO THE TRAILER. ETHEL GOES LAST, LOOKING OF
IN THE DIRECTION BOB TOOK EARLIER THAT DAY. SHE THEN GOES
INSIDE.
CUT TO "THE BEAST" FOLLOWING THE SCENTS OF BOBBY AND "BEA
UP THE SLOPE AMONG THE TREES, THEN FARTHER, UP AMONG THE
ROCKS
VERY TOP OF THE OUTCROPPING, HIGH ABOVE THE ROAD AND TRAI
WHERE BEAUTY MET HER MATCH.
"THE BEAST" TRACES BACK AND FORTH AMONG THE STILL HOT SCE
MAPS OF THE STRUGGLE, GETTING MADDER AND MADDER.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
HE REACHES THE PLATE OF ROCK AND LEAPS UP ONTO IT, RIGHT
THE MIDDLE OF THE ENTRAILS OF BEAUTY.
THE HUGE DOGS SPINS AROUND IN TIGHT CIRCLES, SNIFFING AND
SNORTING AND GROWLING MORE AND MORE, THEN SITS BACK ON HI
POWERFUL HAUNCHES AND LETS OUT A LONG, ANGRY HOWL, JUTTIN
HIS SNOUT RIGHT AT THE UNDERBELLY OF THE MOON.
THERE IS NO SIGN, HOWEVER, OF THE REST OF BEAUTY.
THE HOWL OF "THE BEAST" IS NOW DISTANT, A FAINT TEAR IN T
TO A SMALL COOKING FIRE. ON A CRUDE SPIT, THE CHARRED HAU
SUDDENNESS THAT IS ALMOST SURPRISING, THE FACE OF A YOUNG
WOMAN, PERHAPS 19, FILLS THE FRAME. HER DARK TANGLE OF HA
IS PLAITED WITH DRIED DESERT FLOWERS AND A THIN BRASS CHA
OF THE SORT FOUND IN INDUSTRIAL OR MILITARY USE.
HER FACE IS BURNED DARK BY THE SUN, HER EYES DARK, EVEN W
IS IN NO WAY MIRRORED BY THE ROUGH CLOTHING SHE WEARS AGA
THE COLD.
BUT SHE IS UNMISTAKABLY BEAUTIFUL
AS THE HOWL IN THE DISTANCE DIES, THE GIRL TURNS THOUGHTF
BACK TO THE FIRE AND STUDIES THE HEAT BURNING THERE. SHE
LOOKS BACK INTO THE DARKNESS BEHIND HER, LISTENING. NO SO
BUT A LOW SCRAPING OF WIND.
SHE TAKES THE MEAT FROM THE FIRE AND BEGINS TO EAT. IT'S
LONG SHANK, TOUGH AND FIBROUS SHE TEARS AT IT WITH HER
TEETH, CHEWS AND STARES INTO THE FIRE.
"THE BEAST" HOWLS AGAIN, A LONG, HAUNTING ULULATION. THE
GIRL'S EYES COME UP. SHE DROPS THE MEAT INTO THE FIRE, SP
OUT WHAT'S IN HER MOUTH, STANDS AND WIPES HER HANDS ON HE
RAGGED SKIRT, LOOKING OVER HER SHOULDER IN MOUNTING ALARM
IN SOME RELIEF. CUT TO AN ENORMOUS FIGURE COMING THROUGH
FLAP OF ANIMAL SKIN FROM A FIRE-LIT INNER CHAMBER OF ROCK
IS A WOMAN. HUGE, SMOKEY, ROUGH SKIN, PERHAPS TWO HUNDRED
POUNDS IN WEIGHT, A SNARL OF HAIR, BONE ORNAMENTS, CARTRI
SHELL EARRINGS, RUINED TEETH. SHE LUGS A HALF-GALLON JUG
CHEVAS REGAL. THIS IS MA-MA. SHE COULD BE ANYWHERE FROM
THIRTY-FIVE TO FIFTY.
SHE STUDIES THE GIRL.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
MA MA

text: Warm nuff, Ruby? THE GIRLS NODS DEFERENTIALLY.

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: Y'like yer dog?

head_text.subj: RUBY

text: Yuh, Ma Ma.

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: Ain't every day we get dog. Makes coyote taste like shit.

head_text.subj: RUBY

text: Dog's ghost is talking out there tonight... MA MA LOOKS MORE CLOSELY AT THE GIRL, SMELLING THE FEAR. EYES NARROW.

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: You just got the curse, is all. Makes you haywire. By tomorrow morning you be clean again, can come back in with us. Ain't no such thing as dog ghost!

head_text.subj: THE WOMAN LAUGHS MOUNTAINOUSLY, HER WHOLE BODY SEIZING TH
HUMOR AND SHAKING IT SENSELESS. SUDDENLY SHE STOPS, NOSTR
FLARING. ANOTHER CRY FROM "THE BEAST" LOOPS DOWN AROUND
THEM. THE MATRIARCH LISTENS THOUGHTFULLY.
MA MA

text: Big sonuvabitch. Ain't no fuckin' ghost neither.

head_text.subj: RUBY

text: Nother dog?

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: (nodding) Nother dog. Big ol' stud.

head_text.subj: SHE OFFERS THE JUG OF CHEVAS REGAL TO THE GIRL. RUBY SHAK
HER HEAD "NO." MA MA TAKES A SWIG HERSELF AND STUDIES THE
NIGHT AIR.
MA MA

text: (thoughtfully) Good he's ‘round here. Means he ain't ‘round there. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
RUBY

text: "Round where?

head_text.subj: MA MA

text: Never mind.

head_text.subj: BOBBY TOSSING MORE WOOD ON THE FIRE, WHICH
QUITE A BIT SMALLER NOW. THE BOY WATCHES THE SPARKS SPIRA
UP, LOOK AROUND HIM, THEN HEADS BACK INTO THE TRAILER. TH
PISTOL JUST FROM HIS BACK POCKET. THE DOOR SHUTS BEHIND H
BOBBY LOCKS THE DOOR FROM THE INSIDE, TUGGING AT IT TO MA
DOUBLY SURE IT'S SECURE.
LYNNE

text: Don't look that too secure, old boy, we're going out in a sec.

head_text.subj: LYNNE GIVES BOBBY A PECK ON THE CHEEK AND DUCKS INTO THE
BATHROOM OF THE TRAILER. DOUG APPEARS FROM THE BACK OF TH
DARKENED TRAILER, HIS HAIR ASKEW, HIS SHIRT PULLED OUT, H
FACE FLUSHED.
BOBBY

text: Where you guys going?

text: Several hundred demonstrators still remain at the border, and police confirm now that there were fatalities among... static... busses burned, most of them from Northeastern cities. (pause) We'll have more about that meltdown in Chicago, and weatherman Abby Hoffman reveals all about the Seattle quake and why it won't come here, after this word from the folks at Remington Firearms.

SATISFACTION AS THEIR SIGNAL FIRE GROWS.
TO OTHER FIRES, DOWN THE LINE OF CLIFFS. WE HEAR WHISTLES
AND HOOTS OF CELEBRATION ECHOING DOWN INTO THE DARK CANYO
DOUG AND BOBBY FINISH A QUICK CHECK OF CABINETS,
REFRIGERATOR, ETC. THE PLACE HAS BEEN SOMEWHAT STRAIGHTEN
UP, SO THAT THERE'S MORE A SENSE OF CONTROL OVER THE
SITUATION. BOBBY HAS FOUND PLUTO'S KNIFE AND PLACES IT ON
THE TABLE BEFORE DOUG, WHO IS JUST FINISHING MAKE A CUP O
BULLION FOR BRENDA. WITHOUT ACKNOWLEDGING THE WEAPON, DOU
TAKES THE BREW BACK TO BRENDA.
DOUG GENTLY URGING BRENDA TO DRINK, EASING HE
OUT OF HER SHOCK. BACK IN THE KITCHEN, BOBBY RUNS DOWN TH
SITUATION AS HE SEES IT.
BOBBY

text: They got most of our food, our C/B, extra cartridges, compass, knives, the hatchet... They cleaned us out.

head_text.subj: DOUG SMILES ENCOURAGINGLY AS BRENDA TAKES A SIP. BRENDA
STUDIES HIM OVER THE BRIM OF THE CUP WITH A LOOK OF CRYPT
ATTENTION.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY

text: (continuing) They've killed two of us, maybe three, plus our two dogs, run us into the ditch - - they took your kid, for gosh sakes --

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (turning to him) If you've something to say, why don't you say it?

head_text.subj: BOBBY STRAIGHTENS AS DOUG COMES OVER TO HIM AND LIGHTS A
CIGARETTE, KEEPING HIS EYES ON THE YOUNGER MAN.
BOBBY

text: I don't understand what you're waiting for.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Daylight.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: I think you're afraid.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: You're goddamn right, I'm afraid. So are you, schmuck!

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: I'm not afraid of a bunch of... whatever they are.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: My ass. You're scared shitless. You haven't had that canon out of your hand since I got back this afternoon -- what do you expect me to do, go out and find Shanti by radar?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: You could try.

head_text.subj: DOUG IGNORES THIS. HE POURS HIMSELF A CUP OF INSTANT COFF
BOBBY STARES OUT THE WINDOW AT NOTHING.
DOUG

text: Why don't you try to sleep?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: I'm not sleepy.

head_text.subj: DOUG DRINKS COFFEE AND SMOKES. BOBBY IS MORE AND MORE
IRRITATED BY DOUG'S APPARENT CALM.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY

text: Who were they, anyway?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: I don't know.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: They looked like some sort of motorcycle gang, the glimpse I got. Hell's Angels maybe.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: I don't think so.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Why not?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: No motorcycles.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Maybe Indians. Or escaped convicts. Or mental patients, or part of a Hippy killer clan, or mutants -- this is a test range, you know. They could be some sort of mutants. DOUG SEEMS LOST IN THOUGHT, AND RESPONDS TO NONE OF THIS.

head_text.subj: BOTH MEN ARE ARRESTED SUDDENLY BY THE SOUND OF A WALKIE-
TALKIE TRANSMISSION JUST OUTSIDE THE TRAILER.
BOBBY COCKS THE PISTOL, AND DOUG TURNS OUT THE LIGHT.
SOMETHING SCRATCHES AGAINST THE DOOR. BOBBY FIRES TWO SHO
THROUGH IT BEFORE DOUG CAN GRAB HIS HAND.
DOUG

text: Jesus, Bobby -- take it easy!

head_text.subj: BRENDA IS SCREAMING FOR A MOMENT, THEN IS SILENT. ONCE AG
THERE IS THE SOUND OF THE RADIO, THIS TIME JUST OUTSIDE T
DOOR.

text: Hey, Neptune, you get Ruby t'night? haw! (static answer)

head_text.subj: DOUG, DESPITE BOBBY'S PROTEST, EASES OPEN THE DOOR. A WAL
TALKIE LIES ON THE STAIR OF THE TRAILER, HISSING AND
SPUTTERING. NO SIGN OF ANYTHING OR ANYONE ELSE.
DOUG GINGERLY PICKS UP THE WALKIE-TALKIE, NOTING ITS U.S.
ARMY MARKINGS. HE LOOKS AROUND.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
DOUG

text: Hello?

head_text.subj: THERE'S A LONG MOMENT'S SILENCE, THEN A "WOOF" FROM THE
DARKNESS. DOUG'S FACE LIGHTENS A GOOD DEAL, ALMOST TOWARD
SMILE.
DOUG

text: Beast?

head_text.subj: BUSHES. HE SEEMS AFRAID HE'S GOING TO BE SHOT, BUT DOUG'S
OPEN HAPPINESS AT SEEING THE DOG REASSURES HIM, AND HE'S
HAPPILY BARKING AND PRANCING AROUND DOUG, JUMPING UP ON H
AND BOBBY, LICKING FACES AND GENERALLY CELEBRATING THEIR
REUNION.
DOUG HEFTS THE RADIO, SEEING THAT IT'S BEEN BROUGHT TO HI
"THE BEAST."
DOUG

text: (to "The Beast") You bring this? THE BEAST BARKS PROUDLY. DOUG TURNS TO BOBBY.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Well, by God, we may not know who they are, but now we can know what they're saying to each other -- and I've got a feeling "The Beast" can take me to Shanti.

head_text.subj: THERE'S A SHARP CRACK AND THE TREE BEGINS TO FALL. CUT TO
THE TREE CRASHING DOWN, AND SEVERAL DARK SAV
FORMS RUNNING FOR COVER. THE TREE SMASHES INTO THE GROUND
CUT TO THE TREE HAVING ITS BRANCHES AXED OFF BY SHOUTING
LAUGHING YOUNG SAVAGES, BOTH MALE AND FEMALE. WE RECOGNIZ
ONE OF THE AXES AS THE ONE STOLEN FROM THE TRAILER BY PLU
A LONG PROCESSION OF SAVAGES, THE LONG POLE OF THE STRIPP
TREE OVER THEIR SHOULDERS AS THEY CLIMB OUT OF THE FOREST
UP TOWARDS THE HEIGHTS.
RUBY SITS CURLED UP WITH SHANTI, STRANGELY CONTENT FOR TH
FIRST TIME IN HER LIFE. THE BABY HAS AN ALMOST MAGIC EFFE
ON HER, RADIATING AT ONCE A KIND OF PEACE AND A PURE ENER
THAT MAKES HER FEEL GOOD AND POWERFUL AND EXCITED.
SHANTI WATCHES THE GIRL INTENTLY AS THE GIRL WRAPS HER IN
CLEAN SKINS AND ARRANGES VARIOUS DECORATIONS AND ADORNMEN
ON HER. PLATTED FLOWERS AND TINY NECKLACES.
SEVERAL PERSONS RUSH BY, DRAGGING LARGE MASKS, COSTUMES A
IMPLEMENTS, MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS, CRUDE DRUMS FASHIONED FR
STEEL DRUMS. THEY PASS OUT OF THE CAVE. PLUTO, AMONG THEM
PAUSES, ACUTELY AWARE OF THE FEELING AROUND HIS SISTER AN
BABY. HE POKES A STICK AT THE BABY, APPRAISINGLY. RUBY
PUSHES THE STICK AWAY.
RUBY

text: Don't.

head_text.subj: PLUTO

text: You goin' soft.

head_text.subj: RUBY

text: Ain't.

head_text.subj: PLUTO MAKES TO STRIKE THE INFANT A BLOW WITH THE STAFF HE
CARRYING. RUBY THROWS HERSELF PROTECTIVELY OVER SHANTI.
WHEN NO BLOW FALLS SHE LOOKS UP AT PLUTO, ANGRY AT BEING
CAUGHT SO EASILY.
PLUTO

text: Y'are.

head_text.subj: RUBY

text: (sullenly) Go away.

head_text.subj: PLUTO PASSES OUT OF THE HIDE-FLAPPED CAVE, UNDER CAMOUFLA
NETTING, AND RUNS TO HELP WITH THE TIPPING UP AND STEPPIN
THE TALL PINE MAST.
IN AN ASIDE, WE SEE MARS INSTRUCT ONE YOUNG SAVAGE TO "GO
TAKE OVER FOR MERC'RY." THE SAVAGE DEPARTS. OUR ATTENTION
GOES BACK TO THE TREE RAISING.
IT'S A VERY ARDUOUS, DIFFICULT TASK, BUT WITHIN MINUTES T
THING IS SET AND MADE SECURE.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
ALL UP ITS LENGTH ARE STRANGE AND COLORFUL DECORATIONS
COLORED BUNTING MADE FROM STAINED BANDAGING, BRANCHES OF
FLOWERING WILDWOOD, AND AT THE VERY TOP, WE SEE AS WE ZOO
TERRIBLE GRIMACE OF OUTRAGE.
THERE'S A GENERAL ROUND OF CHEERING AMONG THE SAVAGES, AN
BOTTLE OF EXPENSIVE WHISKY ARE CIRCULATING FREELY, ALONG
EARTHEN VIALS OF STRANGE POWDERS, THAT ARE MIXED WITH THE
DRINKS.
MANY SEEM ALREADY TO BE IN A SORT OF TRANCE, EYES GLAZED,
NOSES STREAMING GREENISH STRINGS OF THICK MUCOUS.
HIGH ABOVE THE FOREST FLOOR THE SAVAGE DIRECTED BY MARS T
RELIEVE MERCURY ARRIVES AT THE LOOKOUT POINT. HE FINDS
MERCURY GONE. HE CASTS ABOUT AND FINDS THE PRINTS OF BOTH
MERCURY, THEN THE BIG PAW PRINTS OF "THE BEAST."
THE YOUNG SAVAGE SMELLS THE BUSH WHERE "THE BEAST" PISSED
FROM ITS ROOTS, SAVAGELY FLINGING IT OVER THE EDGE OF THE
CLIFF.
AS HE FOLLOWS IT DOWN, HE SEES THE BODY OF MERCURY, FAR
BELOW, ON THE ROCKS. HIS FACE REGISTERS ACUTE PAIN, AND H
RACES FOR THE TRAIL DOWN.
THE SAVAGE RUNS UP TO MERCURY, FINDS HIM OBVIOUSLY DEAD.
SAVAGE, WHOSE NAME IS NEPTUNE, LETS OUT A TERRIBLE HOWL O
RAGE AND PAIN, THEN CASTS ABOUT FOR THE RADIO. HE CAN'T F
IT, OF COURSE. HE STRUGGLE WITH THE BODY OF MERCURY UNTIL
HAS IT OVER HIS SHOULDER, THEN GOES OFF TOWARDS THE TRAIL
BACK TO HIS CAMP, AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.
THE TREE STILL SMOLDERS, TRAILING A PLUME OF YELLOW-WHITE
SMOKE UP INTO THE EARLY HAZE OF MORNING. BOBBY AND DOUG
ARRIVE WITH A BLANKET AND POLES, A MAKESHIFT LITTER.
THEY PAUSE AT THE FOOT OF THE TREE. FLIES SWARM UP FROM T
ENTRAILS OF BIG BOB. THE BODY OF COURSE IS GONE.
BOBBY

text: I don't believe this... (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
DOUG

text: They must have come back and taken him in the night.

head_text.subj: HE STARES AT THE GUTS FOR A MOMENT, THEN FORCES HIMSELF T
TAKE HIS EYES AWAY. HE SEES BOB'S CLOTHING IN A HEAP BEHI
THE TREE.
DOUG GOES OVER AND PICKS UP THE CLOTHES, THOUGHTFULLY
DROPPING THEM BACK DOWN. SOMETHING MAKES A METALLIC CLINK
DOUG STOOPS AND MOVES THE CLOTHES UNTIL HE FINDS BOB'S
TROUSERS. FROM THE POCKETS HE REMOVES A WALLET, SOME CHAN
AND A SINGLE KEY.
DOUG GIVES THE EFFECTS OF BIG BOB TO BOBBY AND IMMEDIATEL
HEADS BACK FOR THE TRAILER. BOBBY CATCHES UP WITH HIM. TH
CONVERSATION TAKES PLACE "ON THE RUN."
BOBBY

text: Why would they want his body? This is crazy!

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Recognize the key?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: (ignoring) Do you think we might have gotten ourselves into the middle of some kind of Army maneuvers? I mean, maybe they're some kind of Special Forces gone nuts maybe they don't realize who we are.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (sardonically) Oh? Who are we?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: (with frightened logic) Americans. Civilians, for gosh sakes! They aren't supposed to go around burning and raping and kidnapping us, just because we try to sneak into California without a pass!

head_text.subj: DOUG HAS NO ANSWER FOR THAT. THEY HAVE REACHED THE TRAILE
WHICH IS GUARDED BY "THE BEAST." ONLY A FEW STEPS FROM TH
DOOR OF THE TRAILER ARE TWO GRAVES SCOOPED OUT OF THE SAN
NEXT TO ONE, WRAPPED IN A SHEET, IS THE CORPSE OF LYNNE.
DOUG GOES TO HER.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
DOUG

text: (to Bobby) Give us some help, would you?

head_text.subj: BOBBY HELPS DOUG LOWER LYNNE INTO THE GRAVE. DOUG OPENS T
SHEET TO TAKE HIS FINAL LOOK. LYNNE'S FACE IS DARK RED, A
TWISTED IN A SNARL OF PAIN. EVEN HER EYES, DULL AND WHITE
REMAIN OPEN. DOUG IS CLEARLY SHAKEN. WITH GREAT EFFORT HE
HER FROM THE LIGHT IN THE SHEET. HIS FACE IS ASHEN.
HE CLIMBS FROM THE GRAVE. THERE'S NO SHOVEL, SO HE BEGINS
FILLING THE GRAVE THE SAME WAY HE EMPTIED IT
HANDS.
CUT TO THE DOORWAY OF THE TRAILER. BRENDA LEANS FROM THE
DOOR ENOUGH TO WATCH. HIS EXPRESSION IS ONE OF MUTED HORR
BLANK YET VOLATILE.
BOBBY KNEELS AND BEGINS HELPING PUSH THE EARTH INTO THE H
CUT TO "THE BEAST." HE PLOPS DOWN, HIS EYES ON THE GRAVE,
LOWERING HIS BIG HEAD UNTIL IT RESTS ON THE SAND BETWEEN
PAWS.
DOUG SITS UP. THE GRAVE IS FILLED. DOUG LOOKS AT THE
"BEAST." "THE BEAST" RAISES HIS HEAD AND HIS FACE ANIMATE
TO INTENT READINESS.
DOUG

text: Ready, old boy?

head_text.subj: "THE BEAST" WAGS HIS TAIL AND WHINES ONCE. DOUG STANDS UP
AND BRUSHES OFF HIS TROUSERS. THE "BEAST" IS IMMEDIATELY
GOING. HE SMELLS THE HUNT. DOUG TURNS TO BOBBY.
DOUG

text: I'm going after Shanti. The Beast'll get me there, after that I'll send him back.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Are you serious? Follow that clown? He'll lead you down every gopher hole in the state before he'll take you to Shanti. And what about me? You're leaving me with a dying woman, a freaked out kid sister -- what if they come back? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
THIS LINE OF QUESTIONS IS HURLED AT DOUG AS DOUG GOES ABO
GATHERING THE ARMY C/B, A JAR OF WATER, A "SPACE JACKET"
SUPERTHIN ALUMINIZED MYLAR, AND LAST, ALMOST RELUCTANTLY,
PLUTO'S KNIFE. HE STOPS IN FRONT OF BOBBY.
DOUG

text: If they come back you'll have your hands full, no sense kidding ourselves. But you should have plenty of warning. The way they've been talking on the C/B through the night, it's clear they don't know we have one of their units. I've set our C/B to the same channel, 38. Every half hour or so you should call for help on the military channels -- the ones they're not using.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: What makes you think there's anybody except these guys around?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Look, there's no way the people who hit us are Army, yet they have Army equipment. And it's battery operated, so they can't have had it too long.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: So you're saying they stole it or something.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Or found it, or something. I'll stay in touch with you every fifteen minutes on the quarter hour. The rest of the time I'll be monitoring their channel. If I find out anything you should know, I'll pass it right along. How many rounds do you have?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Nine. Six in the gun, three I found on the floor. I think they've got Dad's gun, and the extra ammunition. Plus most of the useful tools, almost all the food - - I think we have some bullion cubes, a can of shark fin soup hat Lynne bought in Denver. Even they wouldn't eat that

head_text.subj: THE TWO MEN LAUGH FOR THE FIRST TIME IN A LONG WHILE, THE
SHAKE HANDS.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
DOUG

text: If they come for the trailer, I'd suggest you head up into the rocks; you're sitting ducks in this damn thing.

head_text.subj: DOUG WHISTLES TO "THE BEAST." THE DOG BARKS AND RACES
TOWARDS THE SCRUB, THEN BACK AGAIN.
BOBBY

text: And what if I contact the Army or Air Force of whoever the heck it is owns this corner of hell?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (over his shoulder) Tell them to get us the hell out of here, what do you think?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: That's not what I meant. I mean how do I tell them where to find us? DOUG STOPS AND SCRATCHES HIS HEAD.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Burn a tire.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: What?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (half joking) Set the spare tire on fire. It'll make a lot of black smoke. They should be able to see it from a plane or copter. And tell them about the blue line on the map.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: The map ain't the territory.

head_text.subj: DOUG WAVES AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT TO THAT, TURNS AND WALKS AW
"THE BEAST" RUNS AHEAD OF HIM, LOOPING BACK AND AROUND, T
AHEAD AGAIN, UNTIL THE TWO ARE LOST IN THE DISTANCE.
THE DAY IS BARELY BEGUN, YET ALREADY THE SUN'S HEAT IS
UNCOMFORTABLE. BOBBY FLICKS THE SWEAT OFF HIS FOREHEAD AN
WATCHES A SPINNING COLUMN OF DUST DANCE THROUGH THE SAGE
BETWEEN HIM AND DOUG. DOUG DISAPPEARS FROM VIEW.
BOBBY TURNS BACK TO THE TRAILER. BRENDA STANDS NOT TEN FE
AWAY, WATCHING HIM.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY

text: I thought you were injured, or something.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Where are Doug and the Beast going?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: (heading to car) Doug thinks he can just go find those two guys and get them to give Shanti back.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: (following Bobby. ) There's more than two. I heard all those voices on the radio.

head_text.subj: BOBBY OPENS THE DRIVER'S DOOR OF THE STATION WAGON AND PU
THE HOOD RELEASE, THEN GOES TO THE FRONT OF THE CAR. HIS
ATTITUDE TOWARDS BRENDA IS COOL, ALOOF, ANGRY.
BOBBY

text: Thought you were faking all that 'being in shock' stuff.

head_text.subj: HE YANKS OPEN THE HOOD AND REMOVES THE RADIATOR CAP, IGNO
RADIATOR, UNDER THE CAR, AND OPENS THE PETCOCK. WATER BEG
BUMPER AND LOOKS OFF, AWAY FROM BRENDA'S LOOK.
BRENDA

text: (growing hotter) You really are a disgusting human being. HE REFUSED TO LOOK AT HER, AND REFUSES TO RELENT.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: I wouldn't talk, if I were you. Mother's waiting, incidentally.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: (livid) What do you think, I enjoyed it or something? (grabbing him) You think when it really got down to it I... (mockingly) found my pain turning to pleasure? You creep, you rotten son-of-a-bitch shit, you'd like it better if he'd killed me, too? Huh!? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY

text: (screaming) Why didn't he!!? (then, with regained control) Why didn't he?

head_text.subj: BRENDA GLARES AT HIM IN WORDLESS RAGE, THEN TURNS AND GOE
INTO THE TRAILER. BOBBY STANDS UP, STUFFS HIS HANDS IN HI
POCKETS, TAKES THEM BACK OUT, PICKS UP A LARGE ROCK AND H
IT AGAINST THE SIDE OF THE BEACHED STATION WAGON.
CUT ABRUPTLY TO THE SAVAGES WHIRLING MADLY ABOUT THE HUGE
POLE, KEEPING NOTHING BUT THE RHYTHM OF THE SMASHING STEE
DRUMS, REED FLUTES AND HOMEMADE PERCUSSIVE INSTRUMENTS. T
EARLY LIGHT STREAMS OVER BODIES ALREADY COATED WITH DUST
SWEAT, INTO EYES LONG GLAZED WITH MUSHROOM RAPTURE AND TH
ECSTACY OF EXHAUSTION.
SOME OF THEM WEAR MASKS, OTHERS HEADDRESSES, AND A FEW EN
COSTUMES OF FRIGHTENING MIEN. FIERCE BIRDS, FAT POLITICIA
SAVAGE SNAKES, AND, FROM THE PELT OF "BEAUTY," A TERRIFYI
SNARLING DOG-MAN
THE WOMEN PLAY THE PERCUSSIVE INSTRUMENTS, CHANTING AND
SWAYING AS THEY DO, THE MEN, IN THE COSTUMES, SWIRL ROUND
POLE CROWNED BY THE BLEEDING HEAD OF BIG BOB, WHICH NOW H
SWARM OF BEES, FLIES AND GRACKLES SNATCHING AT ITS EYES.
ALL COSTUMES, INSTRUMENTS AND ADORNMENTS, ALL WEAPONS, PR
AND FABRICS ARE TWENTIETH CENTURY, MOST OF THEM ARMY ISSU
BUT ALL HAVE BEEN FASHIONED INTO THE MOST SAVAGELY BEAUTI
AND FRIGHTENINGLY PRIMITIVE DESIGNS.
THE MEN WHIRL AND WHIRL, PULLING OUT KNIVES AND SLASHING
THEMSELVES ON THE ARMS AND LEGS, AND NOW WE BECOME AWARE
THE TENT OF MA MA, A HUGE RED CANVAS AFFAIR ADORNED WITH
STALKS AND HUMAN SKULLS. OVER ITS ENTRANCE IS A SORT OF
PSYCHOTIC'S SHRINE, WITH A WHICKERING BLOOD-RED ALTAR CAN
LIGHTING A CRUDELY FRAMED ICON OF MA MA
FROM SOME BURNED OUT POST OFFICE.
INFANTICIDE, CONSPIRACY
BEFORE THIS IS THE OFFERING, SOMETHING PINK AND HAIRY AND
BLOODY, SWARMING WITH FLIES. THE MEN ARE BEGINNING THE PA
OF THE CEREMONY WHERE THEY TAKE TURNS DANCING IN FRONT OF
THIS, LETTING THEIR OWN BLOOD DRIP ONTO IT, THEN SPINNING
TO MAKE ROOM FOR THE NEXT.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
ALL OF THIS TAKES PLACE UNDER A MUCH LARGER "TENT" OF
CAMOUFLAGE NETTING, WHICH GIVES THE ENTIRE RITE A COVERT,
GUERRILLA THEATRICITY, A SURREALISTIC CIRCUS/TRIBAL/THROW
TO A COLLECTIVE SUBCONSCIOUS ATAVISTIC WET DREAM NIGHTMAR
SOMEONE PULLS A LEATHER THONG. A THIN FLAP AT THE PEAK OF
THE CAMOUFLAGE TENT FALLS OPEN, ALLOWING IN A SHAFT OF
MORNING LIGHT. THE LIGHT PROBES THE SMOKE AND DUST AND FA
AT THE OPENING TO THE CAVE. THE HIDE COVERING THE ENTRANC
IS PULLED BACK AND RUBY, NAKED TO THE WASTE AND GLEAMING
ORNAMENTAL OIL, A NECKLACE OF SILVER COINS STEPS OUT,
CARRYING SHANTI AT ARMS LENGTH.
THE GIRL MOVES UNTIL THE CHILD ENTERS THE COLUMN OF LIGHT
AMONG THIS SEA OF DARK ASH-SMEARED BODIES, DARK COSTUMES
DARK SMOKE, THE NAKED BODY OF THE INFANT GIRL IS
ASTONISHINGLY WHITE AND VULNERABLE.
CUT TO DOUG JOGGING WITH GRIM DETERMINATION IN THE GROWIN
HEAT, A HANDKERCHIEF TIED AROUND HIS FOREHEAD TO KEEP THE
SWEAT FROM HIS EYES. HE TAKES OFF HIS SOAKED SHIRT WITHOU
BREAKING STRIDE AND TIES IT ABOUT HIS WASTE. THE "BEAST"
RANGES JUST AHEAD. HE SUDDENLY HALTS AS THE RADIO BEGINS
RECEIVING TRANSMISSIONS. HE LISTENS WHILE HIS BREATH RASP
OUT OF HIS HEAVING THROAT.
NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) Hey, Home 40, I'm cumin' in.

head_text.subj: THERE'S A CONSIDERABLE PAUSE, THEN PA PA RESPONDS. HE HAS
SHOUT TO EVEN HEAR HIMSELF OVER THE DIN OF THE RITUAL THA
GOING ON ALL AROUND HIM. HE SOUNDS MEAN, CRAZED, DRUNK AN
HIGH.
PA PA

text: (on C/B) Who that?

head_text.subj: NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) Neptune. Pa Pa?

head_text.subj: PA PA

text: (on C/B) Yeah, this's Pa Pa. You s'posed t'be on lookout. I kick your ass if I see you here. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) Pa Pa, Merc'ry's dead. I'm bringin' him in.

head_text.subj: PA PA

text: (on C/B, disbelieving) What you say? I couldn't hear you straight. Sounded like...

head_text.subj: NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) I say Merc'ry's dead. When I got to the look cut post he was gone. I found him at bottom of th' cliff. He got pushed.

head_text.subj: PA PA

text: (on C/B) Who pushed him?

head_text.subj: NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) A dog. A big dog. There's tracks.

head_text.subj: THERE'S SILENCE ON THE C/B. DOUG LOOKS AT "THE BEAST" WHO
SITS NEARBY LISTENING INTENTLY. DOUG HOLDS OUT HIS HAND T
THE BIG DOG.
DOUG

text: (quietly) Shake.

head_text.subj: "THE BEAST" LIFTS HIS RIGHT FRONT PAW. THE MAN AND DOG SH
HANDS.
PA PA BITES A KNUCKLE, THE HANDSET OF THE ARMY FIELD SET
AWAY FROM HIS HEAD WHILE HE PONDERS. HE PUTS IT BACK TO H
EAR AND MOUTH.
PA PA

text: To hell with Merc'ry. Get back on guard. An' call me the second you see anything funny.

head_text.subj: NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) I ain't got no radidio, Pa Pa. I'm callin' from the inner picket. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
PA PA

text: Merc'ry's radidio broke?

head_text.subj: NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) Couldn't find it no where... PA PA LOOKS EVEN MORE UNEASY. IT'S CLEAR HE'S NO DUMMY.

head_text.subj: HE'S NOT JUMPING TO CONCLUSIONS, BUT ON THE OTHER HAND HE
ACCURATELY SEEING POSSIBLE RAMIFICATIONS.
PA PA

text: I'm comin' out. Stay there, an' don't transmit no more unless it's bandits, you 10-four that, Neptune?

head_text.subj: NEPTUNE

text: (on C/B) Eighty-eights and ten, Roger an' out. PA PA SLAMS THE HEADSET ONTO THE RECEIVER.

head_text.subj: DOUG LISTENS FOR ANYTHING MORE. NOTHING. HE LOWERS THE
RADIO AND LOOKS AT "THE BEAST."
DOUG

text: Well, Beast, the fan is about to hit the shit.

head_text.subj: HE BEGINS RUNNING IN THE ORIGINAL DIRECTION AGAIN, FOLLOW
THE EAGER DOG.
THE CEREMONY IS IN FULL SWING. SHANTI HAS BEEN PLACED UPO
RAISED ALTAR. SHE IS FLANKED ON EACH SIDE BY A HUGE CARVI
KNIFE AND FORK. WE MIGHT RECOGNIZE THEM FROM THE TRAILER.
A LARGE COOKING FIRE DOMINATED THE AREA AT THE CENTER OF
RINGED SAVAGE, JUST BEFORE THE BIG POLE. EVERYONE IS BUSY
EATING AND CHANTING ALTERNATELY, PASSING AROUND BIG CHARR
BARBECUED ARMS AND HAMS OF BIG BOB. A "PRIEST" OF SOME SO
IS SPRAYING SHANTI WITH CHICKEN BLOOD. THE FLAPPING
STRUGGLES OF THE BEHEADED FOWL FRIGHTEN THE CHILD AND SHE
BEGINS TO CRY.
PA PA CIRCLES THE SEATED GROUP IN SILENT RAGE UNTIL HE FI
BONE WHEN PA PA YANKS HIM RIGHT UP INTO THE AIR.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
MARS SEES THIS HAPPENING AND COMES OVER, FULL OF TREPIDAT
BUT SHOWING HE'S NEXT IN COMMAND. PA PA'S GESTURES INDICA
THE RELAYING OF NEPTUNE'S NEWS, THAT PLUTO IS TO COME WIT
PA, (ALONG WITH SEVERAL OTHERS)
CHARGE. MARS' GESTURES INDICATE HE SUGGESTS TELLING MA MA
THIS IS IMMEDIATELY DISMISSED BY PA PA. WE SEE MA MA BEIN
RUBBED WITH WARM FAT BY SEVERAL YOUNG FEMALE ACOLYTES.
OTHERS ARE BRINGING HER MORE CHEVAS REGAL. IT'S CLEAR SHE
SHOULDN'T BE DISTURBED. PA PA AND PLUTO GATHER A SMALL
STRIKE GROUP AND DISAPPEAR OUT OF THE TENT, BRISTLING WIT
SPEARS AND SHIELDS.

location: IN THE GROVE NEAR THE SAVAGE HQ.

head_text.subj: PLUTO AND PA PA
COMPOUND AND UP A HILL. THEY CLIMB UNTIL THEY REACH THE
"INNER CIRCLE PICKET." THIS REVEALS IT TO US.
CUT TO DOUG, WATCHING THEM. HE PICKS UP HIS C/B, CHANGES
CHANNEL, AND PUSHES THE TALK BUTTON.
DOUG

text: (quietly) Bobby...? Bobby, you read me?

head_text.subj: EYES. PULL BACK TO REVEAL BRENDA, IN ATTENDANCE. SHE LOWE
HER HEAD ONTO HER MOTHER'S STILL BREAST AND WEEPS
UNASHAMEDLY .
BACKGROUND WE CAN HEAR BOBBY, HIMSELF TRANSMITTING ON THE
TRAILER'S C/B.
BOBBY

text: (B/G)
Mayday, Mayday, this is a breaker one- niner for KUY-9532 -- does anybody read this transmission? We need military or police aid -- Mayday, Mayday.

head_text.subj: HE PUTS DOWN THE MIKE AS BRENDA'S CRYING BREAKS HIS
CONCENTRATION.
BOBBY

text: Brenda, will you keep still?

head_text.subj: BRENDA LEAPS UP IN FURY AND STARTS THROWING EVERYTHING SH

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
BOBBY JUMPS UP AND COUNTERATTACKS, CHARGING THROUGH A HAI
PROJECTILES UNTIL HE CAN GET HIS HANDS ON HER. HE PINS
BRENDA, WHO IS STILL GASPING AND SOBBING, AGAINST A WALL.
BOBBY

text: What're you trying to do, anyway, creep. Give Mom a heart attack?

head_text.subj: BRENDA JUST FIXES HIM WITH AN AWFUL LOOK. BOBBY LOOKS AT
IN CONFUSION, THEN AT THE BED WHERE THE UTTERLY STILL WOM
LIES.
BOBBY LETS GO OF BRENDA. HE SLUMPS AT THE BACK, RAISES HI
SHOULDER INSTINCTIVELY.
BOBBY

text: Oh, no. HE MOVES TOWARDS THE BED.

head_text.subj: DOUG PERSISTS IN TRYING TO REACH BOBBY.
DOUG

text: Bobby? Come in, dammit.

head_text.subj: OTHER SAVAGES WITH THEM CLIMB DOWN FROM THE GUARD STATION
CONFER ONCE MORE, THEN HEAD IN THE DIRECTION OF THE TRAIL
AND BOBBY, BRENDA AND ETHEL. DOUG DESPERATELY TRIES CALLI

DOUG

text: Bobby, do you read me -- they're coming your way, boy -- put your ears on!

head_text.subj: CUT TO INTERIOR OF THE TRAILER, WHERE BOBBY IS AT THE C/B
BUT SWITCHED OVER TO THE MILITARY CHANNEL. HE DESPERATELY
SWITCHES FROM ONE CHANNEL TO ANOTHER, CALLING AGAIN.
BOBBY

text: Hello, Police, Army -- this is KUY-9532 calling Mayday, Mayday, we have been attacked by, well, damn, we've been attacked and need help. HE RELEASES THE TALK BUTTON AND LISTENS FOR ANY RESPONSE.

head_text.subj: THEN, JUST AS HE'S ABOUT TO SWITCH CHANNELS AGAIN, A CRIS
MILITARY VOICE BLARES INTO THE ROOM, LOUD AND CLEAR.

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: MILITARY VOICE

text: Hello, KUY -- we have you loud and clear. This is Sgt. Alcort, U.S. Army intelligence. Please state your position and status of casualties. Over

head_text.subj: BOBBY'S FACE LIGHTS UP IN INCREDULOUS JOY. BRENDA, TOO,
SHOWS IMMENSE RELIEF.
BOBBY

text: Thank God! Hello, listen, they've killed two -- three of us, kidnapped a baby -- we're in desperate need of protection -- uh, but I don't really know where we are. We were on Route 93, about a day past Corn Creek, but we got lost -- I think we're somewhere on one of your bomb ranges... I guess. THERE'S A MOMENT'S PAUSE. ANOTHER MOMENT. THEN.

head_text.subj: MILITARY VOICE

text: The Ellis Range?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Uh, yeah, I guess so. We really don't know...

head_text.subj: MILITARY VOICE

text: Hold on. THE AIR GOES TO STATIC, THEN DEAD. BOBBY LOOKS AT BRENDA. BRENDA LOOKS AT HIM.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: Somehow, he didn't sound too happy when he heard where we were. BEFORE BOBBY CAN RESPOND, THE MILITARY VOICE COMES BACK.

head_text.subj: MILITARY VOICE

text: We are checking with Staff as to procedure. We recommend you make some sort of signal, meanwhile; do you have that capability?

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Sure! We'll burn a tire -- make smoke, okay!? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
MILITARY VOICE

text: Very good. We will put search aircraft into the air and be back to too. Stay on this channel.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: Right! Ten four! BOBBY PUTS DOWN THE MIC, TURNS TO BRENDA.

head_text.subj: BOBBY

text: (cont'd) Don't touch it! HE RACES OUT OF THE TRAILER.

IMMEDIATELY PULLS OUT THE JACK AND BEGINS JACKING UP THE
OF THE STATION WAGON.
JUMP CUT TO HIM PULLING OFF THE TIRE OF THE REAR LEFT. FR
THE CRASH IT IS NEARLY OFF THE RIM ALREADY, AND FLAT. THI
LEAVES THE REAR WHEEL RIM STILL ON THE CAR, BUT THE TIRE

CUT BACK TO BRENDA. SHE'S LOOKING AT THE CLOCK STILL ON T

DOUG
DOUG

text: (replay: 0.S.) I'll stay in touch with you every fifteen minutes on the quarter hour. If I find out anything you should know, I'll pass it right along.

head_text.subj: BRENDA LOOKS TOWARD THE DOOR. NO SIGN OF BOBBY. SHE TURNS
THE CHANNEL SELECTOR TO THE ONE THAT DOUG SPECIFIED FOR T
DOUG

text: (on C/B) Bobby, hello Bobby -- do you read me, over? (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: ABRUPTLY,
BRENDA

text: Doug! It's me, Brenda! Doug, the Army, we've got a hold of the Army!

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (on C/B) What? Are they there!?

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: N-no, they don't know where to find us -- but they've told us to make a signal -- Bobby's out setting a tire on fire, like you told him.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (on C/B) Listen, Brenda, they're coming.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: They Army?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (on C/B) No. The savages. The ones who've taken us on.

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: (instantly terrified.) H-how many?

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: (on C/B) A lot. Nine or ten. You'll have to get out of there and hide -- you've got time - - can Mom travel?

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: She's dead.

head_text.subj: DOUG

text: Do you want me to come back?

head_text.subj: BRENDA

text: No. You get Shanti. We'll take care of these turkeys.

head_text.subj: SOMEHOW IN THE WAY SHE SAYS THIS, BRENDA IMPRESSES
US AS SOMEONE WHO CAN HANDLE THOSE TURKEYS. MAYBE.
CUT TO PA PA, PLUTO AND SEVEN SAVAGES, TROTTING GRIMLY,
EASILY IN THE WAVERING HEAT. SEEN TELESCOPICALLY, THEY LO
LIKE PHANTOMS OF DEATH, HARDLY CONNECTED TO THE SCALDING
SAND.
DOUG GRABS "THE BEAST" BY THE SIDES OF THE HEAD AND LOOKS
RIGHT INTO THE DOG'S EYES.
DOUG

text: Okay, killer, go get that bastard!

BOBBY TOSSES A MATCH AT THE TIRE. IT IGNITES WITH A BIG B

BOBBY

text: How long did he say it'd be before they got here?

head_text.subj: BRENDA

head_text.subj: SHE'S STARING AT SOMETHING ON THE CAR, HER MIND WANDERING
BOBBY RESPONDS TO "THE BEAST" BEING SENT BACK.
BOBBY

text: Big deal. A lot of good that clown'll do us -- hey, where you going?

SCRIPT, ALTHOUGH NOW IT IS NOT. IT WILL BE PART OF A DUMP
ARMY JUNK
SHE TIES ONE END OF THE WIRE LOOSELY AROUND THE REAR BUMP

BOBBY LOOKS AFTER HER AS IF SHE'S GONE CRAZY.
CUT TO THE "BEAST" WATCHING PA PA AND PLUTO AND THE OTHER

MOMENT WE DON'T KNOW WHERE "THE BEAST" IS
CHARGES FROM THE COVER OF THE BUSHES. HE HEADS STRAIGHT F

SHEPHERD "BEAUTY"
LEGS. IN A SINGLE POWERFUL ATTACK OF THE FLASHING TEETH A

AS SUDDENLY, "THE BEAST" IS GONE. THE ENTIRE INCIDENT TAK

THERE IS A HURRIED CONSULTATION. PLUTO IS TOO PROUD TO BE

CUT TO A SHOT MINUTES LATER. PLUTO IS FLAGGING, UNABLE TO

THE VERY HEAVING HEART OF THE SAVAGES' CAMP, WHERE THE

MARS PREPARES SHANTI FOR THE SACRIFICE. HE LAYS HER DOWN

A HUSH FALLS OVER THE THRONG WHEN HE DOES THIS. IT'S AS I
HE'S VIOLATING SOME TERRIBLE TABOO TO TOUCH THE FLAP OF T
RED TENT.
SAVAGE

text: That for Pa Pa. (CONTINUED)

MARS

text: (wheeling) I Pa Pa, now.

MARS ATTACKS MA MA WITH A TREMENDOUSLY AGGRESSIVE SEXUALI
AND SHE STRUGGLES WITH DEMONIC FURY AGAINST HIM, AND YET,

ALLOWED THE POSSIBILITY OF COMING OUT OF THIS WITH MUCH
GREATER STATUS THAN HE'S HAD BEFORE, ALTHOUGH AT RISK OF

DOUG MAKES HIS PLAY, SNATCHING SHANTI AND STUFFING HER UN

A SAVAGE SEES HIM AND GIVES A SHOUT, IS ON HIM, GRABBING
ABOUT THE THROAT. ALMOST IN THE SAME SECOND, SOMEONE STRI

AND RUNNING.
A TERRIFIC SHOUT GOES UP. MARS STUMBLES FROM THE TENT IN

THE CHASE IS ON.
"THE BEAST" WATCHES PATIENTLY AS PLUTO WAVERS AND IS LEFT

BEAST" SEEMS TO HAVE GOTTEN HIM BY A HAMSTRING, FOR SOME

CUT TO PA PA, STOPPING, LOOKING BACK AT THE BOY. SUDDENLY

BOBBY, (C/B)

text: Doug -- the Army says they see my signal - - they're on their way -- (CONTINUED)

BRENDA, (C/B)

text: Wha -- oh (snap)

PA PA'S FACE TURNS INTO PRIMEVAL RAGE.

PLUTO

text: (under breath) Fuckin' devil dog.

PLUTO

text: (enraged) You sonuvabitch! You piece of shit! I killed you buddy, I kill you! I eat your heart, piss dog! Puke eater! I strangle you with you own guts!

GIVING PLUTO THE FINGER. PLUTO LURCHES AT THE BIG DOG. "T

FALLS. THE DOG STOPS, TURNS BACK TO THE YOUNG MAN AND
WATCHES.
PLUTO HOBBLES AWAY FROM THE DOG, NOW, LOOSING NERVE, OR

"THE BEAST" MOVES FORWARD AGAIN, PAUSING AT THE SPOT WHER

text: (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: CONTINUED
"THE BEAST" SMELLS IT, LOWERS HIS MASSIVE HEAD AND
LUXURIOUSLY LAPS UP THE BLOOD, TASTING, SMACKING HIS LIPS
WITH HIS GREAT TONGUE. PLUTO HAS STOPPED AND TURNED, SEEN
THIS.
PLUTO'S FACE. HE SWALLOWS. HE THROWS OFF THE PEL
OF "BEAUTY" AND HOBBLES OFF WITH EVEN MORE EXERTION AND
SWEAT. HE STOPS AND LOOKS BACK. "THE BEAST" HAS
DISAPPEARED.
BOBBY LUGS HIS MOTHER'S CORPSE OUT OF THE TRAILER AND
STAGGERS WITH HER OUT INTO THE DESERT. HIS FACE IS ASHEN
SET, HIS ACTIONS FAST AND DESPERATE.
CUT TO BRENDA IN THE DESERT. B/G PERHAPS A THOUSAND YARDS

BRENDA HAS PULLED THE TELEPHONE WIRE ALL THE WAY OUT HERE
AND NOW IS MAKING A HUGE LOOP OF IT, MUCH LIKE A LASSO, B

ALONG ITS SIDES ITS LOOPS LOW THROUGH THE LIGHT BRUSH,
PERHAPS SIX INCHES OFF THE SAND. THE ENTIRE LOOP IS LOCAT
AT A NATURAL FUNNEL FOR THE TRAIL WHERE ALL THE FOOTPRINT
BOTH OF SAVAGES AND OF DOUG AND "THE BEAST" RUN OUT TOWAR

BOBBY ARRIVES OVER THE CREST WITH THE CORPSE OF THEIR MOT
HE LOWERS HER DOWN, COLLAPSING IN TEMPORARY EXHAUSTION.
BRENDA TAKES THE CAMP CHAIR AND SETS IT UP IN THE CENTER

BRENDA

text: It's too awful. I can't.

text: It's the only way. Com'on.

BOBBY GRABS BRENDA.

text: Stay here until you see them. I'll fix the trailer.  112 113 114 84.
